rrpss

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • rrpss.Database

  • public final class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores and retrieves serialized Restaurant object. This class uses FileInputStream class and ObjectInputStream class in order to read an object from a ".ser" file. For the purpose of writing a serialized object into a ".ser" file, FileOutputStream and ObjectInputStream class are used.

    This Database class allows the main application to load previous saved data and to store any changes made during application execution.

    Warning: All classes which are serialized must implement the Serializable interface!

    Author:
    Edwin Candinegara

    • Method Detail

      • readRestaurantObject

        public static Restaurant readRestaurantObject(java.lang.String path)
        Read a serialized object from a ".ser" file from the given path.

        Warning: All classes which are serialized must implement the Serializable interface!

        Exceptions which may occur during data reading include:

        • ClassNotFoundException
        • StreamCorruptedException
        • InvalidClassException
        • OptionalDataException
        • IOException

        All exceptions have been handled inside the method.
        If there is no exception, the Restaurant object inside the ".ser" file will be returned. Otherwise, null.

        Parameters:
        path - a relative path to the project folder where the ".ser" file resides
        Returns:
        the Restaurant object inside the ".ser" file if it is found, null otherwise
        See Also:
        Restaurant, FileInputStream, ObjectInputStream

      • writeRestaurantObject

        public static int writeRestaurantObject(Restaurant r,
                        java.lang.String path)
        Write a Restaurant object to a ".ser" file stored in the given path.

        If the Restaurant object passed in through the argument is null, return -1.

        Warning: All classes which are serialized must implement the Serializable interface!

        Exceptions which may occur during data reading include:

        • InvalidClassException
        • NotSerializableException
        • IOException

        All exceptions have been handled inside the method.
        If there is no exception, 1 will be returned. Otherwise, -1.
        Parameters:
        r - the Restaurant object to be serialized
        path - a relative path to the project folder where the ".ser" file will be written
        Returns:
        1 if the serialization is successful and -1 otherwise
        See Also:
        Restaurant, FileOutputStream, ObjectOutputStream
